entry.title: Revert "Increase IdlePollingService interval to 15s"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 2ece01ea6ca750ff030d2552da16ac7093c69130.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/6330134757900288



Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8756908096979935201

Affected test(s):

[ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/IdleBrowserTest.Start](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest:browser_tests%2FIdleBrowserTest.Start?q=VHash%3A4796b64b9e9259d1)



If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F6330134757900288&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5258718&type=BUG



Original change's description:

> Increase IdlePollingService interval to 15s

>

> Polling every 1s is consuming more battery than necessary, and we don't

> need that level of granularity. 15s should be unnoticeable for most

> users, and reduces power consumption.

>

> Bug: b/323204044

entry.title: [Hotspot] Decouple TetherHostResponseRecorder from ConnectTetheringOperation
entry.content:
This change removes the dependency on TetherHostResponseRecorder from

ConnectTetheringOperation, placing the responsibility of recording the

response onto the caller (TetherConnectorImpl).



This is done to reduce the scope of ConnectTetheringOperation, slimming

it down to just message exchange responsibilities. When there are multiple

implementations of ConnectTetheringOperation, this will make it easier to

avoid errors by moving as much code which is shared regardless of operation implementation to a common location



TEST=Modified tests to reflect new callsite, Manual Testing



Change-Id: I879e577d280364a0a25555d7afd7188e81602880

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5186399

Reviewed-by: Ryan Hansberry

Commit-Queue: Joe Antonetti

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1256399}

entry.title: Revert "Add user counters for RGB, OkLabOkLch, and out-of-Rec2020"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 49833ca9d8b0e766cbde053be170348ca3816114.



Reason for revert: Failing tests see b/323932550



Original change's description:

> Add user counters for RGB, OkLabOkLch, and out-of-Rec2020

>

> Add counters for the CSS Color Level 4 syntax, dividing the syntax

> into the classes of RGB spaces versus OkLab/OkLch (OkLxx). For these

> two classes, track how often they specify a color outside of the

> Rec2020 gamut.

>

> This is to inform choices about how to handle out-of-range values

> in the OkLab/OkLch syntax.

>

> Mark the counters kCSSColorColorSpecifiedSpace, kCSSColorLabOklab,

> and kCSSColorLchOklch obsolete, because they were observed not to be

> used anymore. Add histograms for CSSCustomStateDeprecatedSyntax

> because auto-generation picked it up.

>

entry.title: Remove explicit use of exclusive mode on database option
entry.content:
The database option `exclusive_locking` is enabled by default.



NOTE: This CL has no functional changes.



It was used to be recommended to explicitly specify it to avoid using

the default DatabaseOptions constructor which had `exclusive_locking`

to false (due historical reason related to unittests migration).



The following CL [landed] fixes the default constructor and by

default all database as using the `exclusive_locking` mode.

see: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5029223



The recommendation from now is to explicitly specify the non

exclusive case with an explanation of why the database can be

accessed in that mode.



Bug: 1120969

Change-Id: Ib278d967c76c1ea8494ebaa4bb1723f0fb74c30e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5251553

Reviewed-by: Maks Orlovich

entry.title: [Protected Audiences] Add renderUrl deprecation warnings.
entry.content:
In particular, print out a warning when the renderUrl fields of the ads

and adComponent arrays in the interestGroup passed to generateBid() are

accessed.



The warning works be lazily populating the renderUrl fields, and

printing a warning when the lazy populating code is invoked.

The non-deprecated renderURL fields are not lazily populated, since

lazily populating things here does not improve performance.



Bug: 1441988

entry.title: HTTPS-First Mode: Keep allowlist when Typically Secure auto-enables HFM
entry.content:
Changing the HTTPS-First Mode pref clears the HTTP allowlist and HTTPS

enforcelist. The pref can be changed manually using the settings UI or

automatically by the Typically Secure User heuristic.



In the latter case, we don't want to clear the allowlist: If a user

previously visited http://example.com, got upgraded to https and

the upgrade fell back to http, subsequent HTTPS upgrades are more

likely to fail as well. Auto-enabling HFM will start showing an

interstitial on this host, but we want auto-enabled HFM to be as

non-disruptive as possible. Not clearing the allowlist prevents us from

showing an extra interstitial on this hostname.



Bug: 1523312

Change-Id: Ib6818a39c0098e102089be84e42f5f1633e2aa16

entry.title: [views_ax] Renaming custom_data_ to override_data_
entry.content:
This CL renames the custom_data_ to override_data_. This is for two

reasons:



1) It now makes more sense relative to its purpose, so its easier to

quickly tell which of the ax_node_data pipeline in Views it is for.



2) Upcoming CLs will consolidate Views' ax_node_data from View to

ViewAccessibility, so we will have two AXNodeData members living in

ViewAccessibility (for the time being). This rename will make it easy

to tell which is which.

entry.title: Ozone: Fix flickering for Rec709 video overlays
entry.content:
To HardwareDisplayPlaneManager::CrtcState, add the

SkColorSpacePrimaries of the output (as indicated by the EDID, or

as we specify for the display to configure itself), and add the

SkColorSpacePrimaries of the most recent plane.



In HardwareDisplayPlaneManager::UpdateAndCommitCrtcState, change

the CTM to be computed to convert from the plane's primaries to

the output primaries.



In CreateDisplayColorSpaces, change the gfx::DisplayColorSpaces to

always use the sRGB color primaries.



This has the effect that the primary plane will be rendered using

sRGB color primaries, and the CTM will convert these primaries to

the display's actual primaries.



This color space conversion is inaccurate because it should be

performed in linear space, but the necessary hardware (the DEGAMMA

look-up table) is unreliable. This is explicitly trading color

accuracy for battery life.



This will fix flickering that occurs when Rec709 video is promoted

to an overlay, because it such video now has the same primaries as

the backbuffer.



Future changes need to enforce that all overlay planes have the same

color primaries. This will need to be done in viz.



Bug: b/282220742

Change-Id: Ib9918a05c8f28df2ab626238419becacd4129b9b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5259644

entry.title: Refactor ContentBrowserClient::IsClipboardCopyAllowedByPolicy parameters
entry.content:
This is a follow-up to crrev.com/c/5245870



This CL updates IsClipboardCopyAllowedByPolicy-adjacent code to prepare

for future DC changes, namely:

- The CL replaces existing parameters to content::ClipboardEndpoint and

content::ClipboardMetadata, which passes extra values used by Data

Controls. For example, `source->web_contents()` will be used to show

tab-modal dialogs to block copies.

- The CL adds a `data` parameter. This will be used by Chrome to allow

data in pastes that was originally replaced at copy time, see

crrev.com/c/5262577 for a overview of how this would work.

- The CL replaces `ClipboardHostImpl::CopyIfAllowed` with specialized

functions `OnCopyTextAllowedResult` and `OnCopyHtmlAllowedResult`

that are bound directly in `WriteText` and `WriteHtml`. This is in

preparation of covering other `Write*` methods with Data Controls,

as other specialized functions like `WriteCustomData` or

`WriteImage` will require special logic to work correctly.





Bug: b/322828428

Change-Id: I4905070020305daf9c8c5bcebaff78598ef1d71e

entry.title: Fix aux click opening two tabs in lens side panel.
entry.content:
When performing a middle click on a search result in the lens side

panel, two tabs were being opened. I believe this is a case that was missed during

the changes made in the following CL to support context menu actions:



https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4178586



To fix this, return a nullptr from OpenURLFromTab which prevents a new

tab from being opened in DidOpenRequestedURL (which also calls

browser()->OpenURL). This follows the pattern in

about_this_site_side_panel_view.cc to handle the same case.

entry.title: Revert "webdialogs: remove OnDialogClosingFromKeyEvent()"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8495c3881a20cf3ba8ec3b3660612df531e004d8.



Reason for revert: broke the Esc close path, https://crbug.com/1522052



Original change's description:

> webdialogs: remove OnDialogClosingFromKeyEvent()

>

> This method was only overridden in one place, where it was used to call

> OnDialogClosed() unnecessarily - in that situation, the dialog is just

> about to close anyway, so OnDialogClosed() is about to be run by

> WebDialogDelegate itself. This change deletes the method, its only

> override, and its only call site. Simplification of

> PrintPreviewDialogController as a result might be possible, since it no

> longer needs to tolerate multiple calls to OnDialogClosed().

>

> This change does not add an automated test. I tried to do so, but:

> * A unit test that doesn't depend on Views didn't work: there's no way

> to send key events to the dialog directly without Views APIs;

> * A unit test that does depend on Views required putting a single unit

> test for this code, which otherwise doesn't use Views, in a different

> part of the source tree, which seems very ugly;

> * A non-unit test that doesn't depend on Views would need to be an

> interactive ui test so that it could use ui_controls::SendKeyPress().

> Given the cost of interactive ui tests, how flaky they generally are,

> and the low risk of this code regressing in the future, this seems not

> worth writing.

>

> Instead, I manually tested that I did not regress the behavior.

>

> Bug: 1485127

> Change-Id: I804d56adff25739618646f8c6ee926a4c371342a

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4994890

entry.title: [Extension Bindings] Use returns_async to define all async returns
entry.content:
This CL completes the rework of how asynchronous returns are represented

in extension API schemas and the model the JSON schema compiler

generates from them. Now all asynchronous returns are represented with

the 'returns_asyc' field and default to supporting promise based calls

unless the 'does_not_support_promises' field is specified.



The IDL schema processing has also been updated to reflect this, with

one exception case being added with a new extended attribute for the two

automation APIs which have a trailing function parameter which is a

function that gets called more than once.



Along with all these changes, the remaining JSON schemas have been

updated to define their async returns using the 'returns_async' field,

with any remaining non-promise supporting functions being marked as

such with a description and link to a tracking bug for that case where

appropriate.



Bug: 978538, 1288583

Change-Id: I042bb70e7dd171b1aa1d88ea85b27ef4b87e9ef3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5121609

Reviewed-by: Ovidio Ruiz-HenrÃ­quez

entry.title: [ios][TipsNotifications] Fix issue with Notification opt-in alert
entry.content:
Code that uses the new NotificationOptInAlertCoordinator needs to set

the push notification client id so that the correct pref gets set. It

also needs to set a confirmationMessage to display when opted-in.



This also fixes an issue where the incorrect messages were being

displayed in the alert when opting into content notifications.



There are a few additional issues with these toggles that should be

fixed in a later CL:

* we probably want to not show the snackbar confirmation here since

the toggle is already an indication that the user has opted in.

* the toggle should not flip until the OptInAlert flow has completed

because it is possible the user has not given authorization.



Bug: 1519595

entry.title: [passwords] Remove PasswordManagerClient::GetSyncState()
entry.content:
No behavioral changes, pure refactoring.



The removed function represented interface-level redundancy as there

is also PasswordManagerClient::GetSyncService(). This redundancy is bad

because it can lead to non-realistic scenarios in tests.



Instead, the one single caller is migrated to invoking

sync_util::GetPasswordSyncState() directly. Theoretically, this may

imply a behavioral change because the old code (before this patch)

could have instantiated SyncService, but this is deemed impossible as

the codepath cannot be exercised early upon profile construction, and

if it did the function would have returned kNotSyncing anyway.



This also means the enum SyncState can be moved to password_sync_util.h.

While doing so, kNotSyncing is renamed to avoid ambiguities when

account passwords are involved. The remaining enum values will be

tackled in follow-up patches.



Finally, if PasswordManagerClient::GetSyncService() is here to stay,

there is no point is having to pass a RepeatingCallback to

SyncCredentialsFilter in order to access SyncService.



Change-Id: Ice19affc3c9af2b6568c5fd15436ad08adeb8351

Bug: b/317058107

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5260099

entry.title: [Read Aloud] Workaround for bug where brackets would be split.
entry.content:
This bug causes opening punctuation to be split, so "Hello.[2]"

would be read aloud as "Hello opening square bracket" and "2."



With this change, the same segment will now be read out as "Hello"

and "2."



This is a temporary workaround- I'm investigating if it would be

feasible to get a more permanent fix into the ax_utils libraries.



Note: this appears to work in both LTR and RTL languages.

entry.title: [presubmit] ICU syntax check: allow =2 and =3 cases
entry.content:
Manually add =2 and =3 numeric cases to the allowed syntax of the ICU

syntax presubmit check.



While a generic solution that recognizes all possible numeric cases

automatically would also fix this for the =4 case and above, this

solution here is simpler and seem sufficient, given that the vast

majority of strings use up to =3 (at this point there is a single =4

case in the codebase, and none above).

entry.title: [dPWA] Preprocess icon downloads to support SVGs for PWA installs
entry.content:
This CL implements the proposed solution in go/svg-web-applications to

support icons of size:any. The process is:

1. Keep track of icons with no size during manifest parsing in

the early stages of the install process.

2. Prior to icon downloading, parse these URLs and assign sizes to

icons.

3. Post downloading, if icons do not have any intrinsic sizes to

them, disregard them from being assigned for multiple purposes (like

file handling).



Also includes a unit-test for manifest parsing logic, and

a parameterized browser test for the whole install flow.



Verified manually using https://denim-unique-blackbird.glitch.me/



Bug: b/319669415, crbug.com/1444121, crbug.com/1225906

entry.title: [iOS] Apply safe area inset to the web view
entry.content:
When going on landscape mode the safe area is not respected so dedicated

landscape websites are hidden under the notch and lead to have

inaccessible area. To fix that, apply the safe area to the web view

directly at creation and at all updates to ensure this is taken into

account.



See videos:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1c9hScQhA1l3mYUs38qZ5V0jCLawgFdsR/view?usp=drive_link

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WetT-OHjfGKuzzV1yiV-qcnBMc70Nj2g/view?usp=drive_link



Also to avoid regression, this CL also add a way to manage a specific

CSS value "viewport-fit=cover" so the web view take the entire screen.

This is a known bug see crbug.com/1394631 and crbug.com/1150075 for more

infos.



See videos:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bqSNodi6thyAPDCskTiFN4buarYHjn9d/view?usp=drive_link

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1b_ov445QRtPXDjuOihJJqnncep8t5g1Z/view?usp=drive_link



Pair-programming: ajuma@



Fixed: 1504344, 1394631, 1253344

entry.title: [FSA] Fix locking failure when child name is the same as parent.
entry.content:
Currently, taking a lock on a file path fails if the components of the

file path contains any same name amongst themselves. For example,

"/foo/foo" or "/foo/bar/foo" fails. This is due to `child_locks_` map

is keyed on a component name (i.e. "foo", "bar"); instead, it should use

a unique key, such as a full file path.



Bug: 1523851

entry.title: [A11y] Invalidate AXIDs when those objects are removed
entry.content:
After CL:4185636, an AXObject may have been detached and recreated

with the same DOM node, and therefore has the same id (the dom node id).

This breaks the accessibility object caching mechanism used for web

tests, which assumes that if it sees the same ID, it can assume the

object is still the same one. The fix is to notify the caching

mechanism of detached AXObjects so that it can invalidate the

corresponding entries.



Bug: none

entry.title: firmware_update: Add aria-live to user request body to improve a11y
entry.content:
This CL adds an aria-live = "assertive" attribute to the dialog body

element when the app is waiting for user request. This way, ChromeVox

will notify the user when action is required.



I've also removed unnecessary "tabindexes" (no need to tab through

uninteractive elements -- ChromeVox still works without them).



I've also removed the dynamic "aria-hidden" logic, and just removed

the aria-hidden tag altogether from the dialog body. In my testing,

this had no impact on the ChromeVox output either way, and having

aria-hidden prevented ChromeVox from reading the aria-live content.



Demo: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WpbmmQw7LSl6z_90wZ2zkN1260invZwn/view?usp=drive_link&resourcekey=0-qVzHZ_5Q-80FLB7DVzK1SQ



Test: browser_tests -f=*FirmwareUpdateAppBrowserTest*

Bug: b/308669841

entry.title: Increase IdlePollingService interval to 15s
entry.content:
Polling every 1s is consuming more battery than necessary, and we don't

need that level of granularity. 15s should be unnoticeable for most

users, and reduces power consumption.

entry.title: [FedCM] Allow API to be called when the call site is invisible
entry.content:
When a user opens the call site in a new tab, currently we'd terminate

the API flow. From UX's perspective, we should prepare the FedCM UI in

such case and show it when the user switches to that tab.



Since we start to support showing the UI in a new tab, we should also

update the way to record metrics to keep their initial meaning. e.g.

to measure how much time a user would spend between seeing the accounts

UI and interacting on it, we should use the moment that the user sees

the UI instead of the previous "ready-to-show" moment. To achieve that,

this patch also adds some callback to capture the moment when we show

the accounts UI for the first time.



Bug: 1384543

entry.title: Add unit test verifying BMP Suite "good" test cases.
entry.content:
The CL at https://crrev.com/c/5253842 is blocked on Skia Gold

issues. Splitting this CL out so we can land the tests sooner and

focus on Skia Gold-specific fixes in a separate, focused CL.

This largely matches Patchset 4 of the above CL, with the requested

fixed applied and a LICENSE file added.



We now verify that BMPs classified as "good" in Jason Summers'

BMP Suite (https://entropymine.com/jason/bmpsuite/) are a pixel-

perfect match for their PNG reference equivalents, when decoded

via BMPImageDecoder.



One of the tests (pal8v4) was not pixel-perfect but is visually

equivalent at a glance. Based on the comments in the text, this

is likely due to slightly-incorrect gamma and chromacity values

in the test file, not a bug in the decoder.



Test images are public domain, created by BMP Suite 2.8.



Bug: 1523036

entry.title: Support :user-valid/:user-invalid on checkboxes
entry.content:

browsers support :user-valid/:user-invalid on them. The existing

:user-valid/:user-invalid machinery only works on text fields, so this

patch adds some code to checkboxes to make them work as well.

entry.title: [iOS] Check storage quota before saving to Drive
entry.content:
This CL changes the Save to Drive flow so that when the user selects

Drive as a destination for their downloads and taps "Save", the mediator

will first check if the selected identity has enough storage for the

upload to succeed, using a file uploader object. If there is enough

storage for the upload to succeed, then the normal flow will resume i.e.

the task will be registered with the Drive tab helper and started with

the Download manager tab helper, and the Save to Drive UI will hide.

Otherwise, a "Manage Storage" alert is presented with two options:

- "Manage Storage": opens a page for the user to free storage or get

more storage, in a new tab.

- "Cancel": hides the alert and lets the user select a different account

or try again with the same account.



Bug: 1495354

entry.title: Add PNG eXIf chunk support
entry.content:
The PNG eXIf chunk has been in the extension part of the PNG spec for a long

time now. libpng already supports eXIf (outside of push mode).



http://www.libpng.org/pub/png/spec/register/pngext-1.4.0-pdg.html



In PNG Third Edition, eXIf is becoming an official part of the main spec and

not just in the extensions. As such, Chromium should officially support it.



There is a WPT which tests if the eXIf chunk is recognized by setting an

orientation:

https://wpt.fyi/results/png/exif-chunk.html?label=experimental&label=master&aligned



This commit adds support for the eXIf PNG chunk (updating orientation) to Chromium.



Note, libpng supports eXIf in non-push mode. Chromium uses push mode.

It seems like when eXIf support was added to libpng they simply forgot push mode.

This commit also adds support for eXIf to libpng's push mode.



Change-Id: Ibda3b9a4f59ad5787fb441d6db015e564c1798ed

entry.title: Allow streaming local compile hints if code cache requires hash check
entry.content:
For certain scenarios, such as WebUI and webviews, code cache data is

provided to Blink before it has been validated to actually match the

loaded script data. In those scenarios, Blink is responsible for

checking that the hash of the script text matches the hash stored in the

code cache entry, and not using the code cache data if it doesn't match.

When LocalCompileHints is enabled, the script streamer attempts to use

the hints from the code cache data before the full text of the script

has been loaded, so it can't yet compute a hash of the script text. This

is okay; using the wrong compile hints might compile a non-optimal set

of functions, but wouldn't cause incorrect behavior. This change avoids

CHECK failures when starting to use compile hints during streaming.



Bug: 1495723

Change-Id: If6a99d42fe256c3b1807ec85a684e6ee8710c46b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5238341

entry.title: [SW-3] Remove NavigationLoaderInterceptor::MaybeCreateSubresourceLoaderParams
entry.content:
To consolidate information into `loader_callback`.



For this purpose, this CL introduces

`NavigationLoaderInterceptor::Result` that combines

the `loader_callback` argument +

the `MaybeCreateSubresourceLoaderParams()` return value,

and passes `std::optional` to `loader_callback`.



See design doc

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KZAXIxUBbEpToCRUK7fojmirRNsiqaROZrUzOp2FxB4/edit#bookmark=id.so0ntpqrhur2

for mapping from `loader_callback` +

`MaybeCreateSubresourceLoaderParams()` into new `std::optional`.

This is straightforward, except that the

`loader_callback(nullptr)` +

`MaybeCreateSubresourceLoaderParams()` returning `std::nullopt`

is mapped to `std::nullopt`.



This CL enables `loader_callback` to fallback to the network

without setting intercepting factory or `subresource_loader_params`

by passing `Result(nullptr, nullopt)`.

This is not used in this CL but will be used in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5252956.



Bug: 1403746

Change-Id: Iccfcf1d594cecaa129455314186340abe1e975c1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5243773

entry.title: Change the flag of enabling filtering fDO reports to a timedelta.
entry.content:
We used a boolean flag to enable filtering fDO reports. This CL changes it to a feature param for flag kFledgeSampleDebugReports. The feature param is a TimeDelta, representing DeltaSinceWindowsEpoch. Set it to 0 to disable filtering fDO reports, and non-zero to enable it. Lockout and cooldowns collected before this time will be ignored, to avoid locking ad techs out due to they were using fDO APIs before we enabling filtering.

entry.title: [A11y] Do not include hidden nodes when they are ignored
entry.content:
The only time we need hidden nodes is when they are part of a

label or description. This CL keeps track of whether a given node

has ever been part of a label or description. If the node is hidden,

it removes it from the tree unless it's needed for a label/description.



In combination with CL:4852390, which removes hidden line breaks,

reduces the time spent in serialization and deserialization by

massive amounts in tests that involve heavy usage of hidden subtrees.

For the specific results, see:

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ozLJMRT32yIxE0ja0rDhdZPb76hQtDd0klcRcR_uWYU/edit?pli=1#gid=0

This will make a significant difference in web apps with panels,

chats, slides, etc. where a significant percentage of the content

is hidden.



Bug: 1448706, 1353788

entry.title: [ios][TipsNotifications] Only show each type of Tips notification once
entry.content:
This change stores whether each type of notification has been sent in

a bitfield in local state prefs. This information is used to ensure we

only send each type at most once. Because pending notification requests

are cleared on startup if they have not triggered, we also need to

clear the bit for that type of notification when the pending request is

cleared so that type is able to be requested again.

entry.title: [UPM] Handle initial local passwords migration correctly.
entry.content:
The CL makes changes to the PasswordStoreBackendFactory for the Android platform. Now different backend will be created depending:



UPM M3: The password store migration decorator is created as backend in

case if the initial migration was not done yet. It is expected to

migrate the passwords from the built in profile store to the GMS core

local store. Otherwise, proxy backend will be created.



UPM M2: The password store proxy backend is created. No migrations are

needed.



Old UPM: The password store migration decorator is created as backend.

There are no split stores at this stage, and the decorator is expected

to migrate the passwords from the built in profile store to the GMS core

account store.



The check whether the local migration is needed was moved in the

migrator to eliminate the possibility of calling the initial migration

for account backend.



Bug: b/322347884

Change-Id: I2901ab48caa58ea839bca2f2ad286eedf5e3ef65

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Add FrameResource support to V4L2Queue
entry.content:
V4L2Queue or V4L2Buffer now supports either VideoFrame or FrameResource.

To handle this change, FrameResource is used as the native storage type

for both V4L2Queue and buffer types. VideoFrame objects are wrapped as

a VideoFrameResource before being stored in the V4L2Queue, so it can be

converted back to VideoFrame for use by the GetVideoFrame methods.



Getting a VideoFrame from the GetVideoFrame API's will only work when

the stored frames are are VideoFrameResource-type. This is okay because

a client of a particular V4L2Queue is expected to use VideoFrame or

FrameResource API's. Not both.



The V4L2Buffer class also uses VideoFrameResource for now for frames

that allow access to MMAP buffers. This is only used by decoders. This

is planned to be changed to NativePixmap FrameResource when it is ready.

entry.title: Add a field to track whether speech pause is triggered from the
entry.content:
play/pause button toggle.



This is because we want to differentiate between pauses that come from

the play/pause button from pauses that come from a menu selection. For

the play/pause button, we want to call synth.pause() then

synth.resume(), because this continues reading from the word that was

paused. For menu changes, we want to call synth.cancel() then

synth.play(), because this allows the menu changes to take effect and

shows the user that the app is responsive to their changes.



However, synth.cancel() and synth.play() starts speaking from the

beginning of the utterance. This is why we don't want to use this for

the play/pause button. This will change when we handle word level

tracking, but for now we need this temporary code change.



Bug: 1474951
